args.natural_language_statement: Let G,H\subset GL(n) be matrix groups (each consisting of n\times n matrices). Prove that G\cap H is a matrix group. End the Lean statement with := by sorry

result: {"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib\n\nexample {G H : Set (Matrix n n (Fin 2))} (hG : IsMatrixGroup G) (hH : IsMatrixGroup H) : IsMatrixGroup (G ∩ H) := by sorry"}

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- If G and H are matrix groups (subgroups of the units of n × n matrices over a ring),
then their intersection is again a matrix group. -/
variable {R : Type*} [CommRing R]
variable {n : Type*} [Fintype n]

theorem matrix_group_inter (G H : Subgroup (Units (Matrix n n R))) : Subgroup (Units (Matrix n n R)) := by sorry
